title: Cell mate of murdered gangland killer Carl Williams charged with murder
text:
A jailhouse chum of gangland killer Carl Williams has been charged over a historic underworld crime.

'Little’ Tommy Ivanovic, known as ‘The Gun’, had been in the room when Williams was killed in prison by Matthew Johnson on April 19, 2010.

On Wednesday, he was arrested over the murder of Richard Mladenich, who is believed to have been one of Williams' first hired hit jobs.

Richard Mladenich was shot dead at the Esquire Motel in St Kilda almost 20 years ago. A jailhouse mate of underworld figure Carl Williams was arrested over the killing on Wednesday.

'Little’ Tommy Ivanovic, known as ‘The Gun’, had been in the room when Williams was killed in prison by Matthew Johnson (pictured) on April 19, 2010.

Ivanovic was arrested in Moreland Rd, West Brunswick - just north of Melbourne - at 11am by investigators from the Purana taskforce.

He had only been released from jail last year over a 2002 road rage murder in West Brunswick.

Police had believed he was also on the phone within minutes of the attack on Williams to a man police suspected organised the hit on him.

Although he has never been charged over the murder.

Ivanovic had his share of enemies in the underworld and had himself been stabbed in Barwon Prison in what was suspected as revenge for an attack on a former mate three years earlier.

The Herald Sun reported he will be interviewed over the Mladenich murder and allegations of cocaine trafficking and vehicle insurance fraud.

Mladenich was shot dead at the Esquire Motel in St Kilda almost 20 years ago.

He had been regarded as an odd standover man and drug dealer.

His killer was seen wearing dark sunglasses by at least three witnesses.

Police launched a major review into the cold case in July this year, issuing a $1 million reward for information leading to a conviction.

Ivanovic is allegedly a close associate of both underworld figure Rocco Arico and Williams' killer, who is head of the prison gang Prisoners of War.

Carl Williams was suspected of ordering the hit against Richard Mladenich, who was killed almost 20 years ago

Matthew Johnson prepares to kill Carl Williams inside Barwon Prison in 2010. Tommy Ivanovic had been held in the same unit as both of the men and was once a trusted friend of the gangland killer

The weapon Matthew Johnson used to murder Carl Williams. Police thought Tommy Ivanovic may of had something to do with it, but he has never been charged

The killing of Williams sent shock waves through the Victorian crime community with many seeing it as the end of a chapter in Victoria's long running crime war.

Ivanovic was the only other prisoner in the room when Williams was fatally attacked, at a time he was rumoured to be assisting police.

Johnson was eventually convicted of Williams' murder and sentenced to 32 years in prison.
